verses.kjv: Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.
verses.ct: Listen to my just cause, LORD. Pay attention to my cry. Hear my prayer, for it comes from honest lips.

verses.kjv: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.
verses.ct: Let my vindication come from your presence; let your eyes see what is right.

verses.kjv: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.
verses.ct: You have examined my heart; you have come to me in the night. You have tested me and found nothing wrong. I have determined that my mouth will not sin.

verses.kjv: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.
verses.ct: As for what others do, by following your word I have avoided the ways of the violent.

verses.kjv: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.
verses.ct: Keep my steps steady on your paths so that my feet do not slip.

verses.kjv: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.
verses.ct: I am calling out to you because you will answer me, God. Turn your ear toward me and hear what I have to say.

verses.kjv: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.
verses.ct: Show your amazing love, you who rescue with your powerful hand those who take refuge in you from their attackers.

verses.kjv: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,
verses.ct: Guard me as the pupil of your eye; shelter me in the shadow of your wings

verses.kjv: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.
verses.ct: from the wicked who assault me, from my deadly enemies who surround me.

verses.kjv: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.
verses.ct: Their hearts are hard and unfeeling; their mouths speak with arrogance.

verses.kjv: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;
verses.ct: They have tracked us down and now close in around us, fixing their gaze to throw us to the ground.

verses.kjv: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.
verses.ct: They are like a lion eager to tear its prey apart, like a young lion crouching in hiding.

verses.kjv: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:
verses.ct: Rise up, LORD! Confront them and bring them down. Rescue my soul from the wicked with your sword.

verses.kjv: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
verses.ct: With your hand, LORD, rescue me from such people â€” people of this world whose reward is only in this life. You fill their stomachs with your hidden treasures; they have plenty of children and leave their wealth to their offspring.

verses.kjv: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.
verses.ct: But as for me, I will see your presence in righteousness. When I wake, I will be satisfied with seeing your likeness.
